atmosphere.thick: Thick atmosphere, breathable with a pressure mask
entity.asteroidBase.situation.priceless: Hit a priceless vein of ore
entity.asteroidBelt.occupation.pirates: Pirates hiding out among the rocks
entity.gasGiantMine.occupation.mine: Scrappers in the ruined old mine
entity.refuelingStation.situation.distre: A ship is in severe distress
entity.researchBase.occupation.scientist: Scientists from a major local corp
entity.researchBase.occupation.secret: Secret employees of a foreign power
tags.abandonedColony.description: The world once hosted a colony, whether human or otherwise, until some crisis or natural disaster drove the inhabitants away or killed them off. The colony might have been mercantile in nature, an expedition to extract valuable local resources, or it might have been a reclusive cabal of zealots. The remains of the colony are usually in ruins, and might still be dangerous from the aftermath of whatever destroyed it in the first place.
tags.abandonedColony.friends.2: Local wanting the place cleaned out and made safe
tags.abandonedColony.complications.0: The local government wants the ruins to remain a secret
tags.abandonedColony.complications.1: The locals claim ownership of it
tags.abandonedColony.complications.2: The colony is crumbling and dangerous to navigate
tags.abandonedColony.things.1: Relic stolen by the colonists when they left
tags.abandonedColony.things.2: Historical record of the colonization attempt
tags.abandonedColony.places.2: Structure buried by an ancient landslide
tags.alienRuins.description: The world has significant alien ruins present. The locals may or may not permit others to investigate the ruins, and may make it difficult to remove any objects of value without substantial payment. Any surviving ruins with worthwhile salvage almost certainly have some defense or hazard to explain their unplundered state.
tags.alienRuins.things.1: Objects left with the remains of a prior unsuccessful expedition
tags.alteredHumanity.description: The humans on this world are visibly and drastically different from normal humanity. They may have additional limbs, new sensory organs, or other significant changes. Were these from ancestral eugenic manipulation, strange stellar mutations, or from an environmental toxin unique to this world?
tags.alteredHumanity.complications.1: Alteration is necessary for long-term survival
tags.alteredHumanity.complications.2: Locals fear and mistrust non-local humans
tags.alteredHumanity.things.1: Valuable biological byproduct from the mutants
tags.alteredHumanity.things.3: Record of the original colonial genotypes
tags.alteredHumanity.places.1: An environment requireing the mutation for survival
tags.alteredHumanity.places.2: A sacred site where the first local was transformed
tags.anarchists.description: Rather than being an incidental anarchy of struggling tribes and warring factions, this world actually has a functional society with no centralized authority. Authority might be hyperlocalized to extended families, specific religious parishes, or voluntary associations. Some force is preventing an outside group or internal malcontents from coalescing into a power capable of imposing its rule on the locals; this force might be an ancient pretech defense system, a benevolent military AI, or the sheer obscurity and isolation of the culture.
tags.anarchists.enemies.2: Exploiter taking advantage of the lack of centralized resistance
tags.anarchists.complications.0: The anarchistic structure is compelled by an external power
tags.anarchists.complications.1: The anarchy is enabled by curently abundant resources
tags.anarchists.complications.2: The protecting force that shelters the anarchy is waning
tags.anarchists.things.0: A macguffin that would let the possessor enforce their rule on others
tags.anarchists.things.1: A vital resource needed to preserve general liberty
tags.anarchists.things.2: Tech forbidden as disruptive to the social order
tags.anthropomorphs.description: The locals were originally human, but at some point became anthropomorphic, either as an ancient furry colony, a group of animal-worshiping sectarians, or gengineers who just happened to find animal elements most convenient for surviving on the world. Depending on the skill of the original gengineers, their feral forms may or may not work as well as their original human bodies, or may come with drawbacks inherited from their animal elements.
tags.anthropomorphs.enemies.2: Outside exploiter who sees the locals as subhuman creatures
tags.anthropomorphs.friends.1: Diplomat trained to deal with normals
tags.anthropomorphs.complications.0: The locals consider their shapes a curse from their foolish ancestors
tags.anthropomorphs.complications.1: Society is ordered according to animal forms
tags.anthropomorphs.complications.2: The locals view normal humans as repulsive or inferior
tags.anthropomorphs.things.1: A "cure" that may not be wanted
tags.anthropomorphs.places.1: Nature reserve suited to an animal type
tags.anthropomorphs.places.2: Living site built to take advantage of animal traits
tags.area51.description: The world's government is fully aware of their local stellar neighbors, but the common populace has no idea about it, and the government means to keep it that way. Trade with government officials in remote locations is possible, but any attempt to clue the commoners in on the truth will be met with lethal reprisals.
tags.area51.enemies.1: Free merchant who likes his local monopoly
tags.area51.enemies.2: Local who wants a specimen for dissection
tags.area51.complications.0: The government has a good reason to keep the truth concealed
tags.area51.complications.1: The government ruthlessly opresses the natives
tags.area51.complications.2: The government is actually composed of off worlders
tags.area51.things.2: Possessions of the last offworlder who decided to spread the truth
tags.badlandsWorld.description: Whatever the original climate and atmosphere type, something horrible happened to this world. Biological, chemical, or nanotechnical weaponry has reduced it to a wretched hellscape. Some local life might still be able to survive on its blasted surface, usually at some dire cost in health or humanity.
tags.badlandsWorld.friends.0: Native desparately wishing to escape the world
tags.battleground.description: The world is a battleground for two or more outside powers. They may be interstellar rivals, or groups operating out of orbitals or other system bodies. Something about the planet is valuable enough for them to fight over, but the natives are too weak to be anything but animate obstacles to the fight.
tags.battleground.complications.0: The war just ended as both sides are leaving
tags.battleground.complications.1: The natives somehow brought this on themselves
tags.battleground.complications.2: A small group of natives profit tremendously from the fighting
tags.battleground.things.0: A cache of the resource the invaders seek
tags.battleground.things.2: Precious spy intelligence lost by someone
tags.beastmasters.description: The natives have extremely close bonds with the local fauna, possibly having special means of communication and control through tech or gengineering. Local animal life plays a major role in their society, industry, or warfare, and new kinds of beasts may be bred to suit their purposes.
tags.beastmasters.enemies.0: Half-feral warlord of a beast swarm
tags.beastmasters.enemies.2: Altered beast with human intellect and furious malice
tags.beastmasters.friends.0: Native bonded with an adorable animal
tags.beastmasters.complications.0: The "animals" are very heavily gengineered humans
tags.beastmasters.complications.1: The animals actually run the society
tags.beastmasters.complications.2: The animals have the same rights as humans
tags.beastmasters.things.0: Tech used to alter animal life
tags.beastmasters.things.1: A plague vial that could wipe out the animals
tags.beastmasters.things.2: A pretech device that can perform a wonder if operated by a beast
tags.beastmasters.places.0: Park designed as a comfortable home for beasts
tags.beastmasters.places.1: Public plaza designed to acommodate animal companions
tags.bubbleCities.description: Whether due to a lack of atmosphere or an uninhabitable climate, the world's cities exist within domes or pressurized buildings. In such sealed environments, techniques of surveillance and control can grow baroque and extreme.
tags.bubbleCities.enemies.2: Local official hostile to outsider ignorance of laws
tags.bubbleCities.friends.0: Local rebel against the city officials
tags.bubbleCities.friends.1: Maintenance chief in need of help
tags.bubbleCities.things.2: Master key codes to a city's security system
tags.cheapLife.description: Human life is near-worthless on this world. Ubiquitous cloning, local conditions that ensure early death, a culture that reveres murder, or a social structure that utterly discounts the value of most human lives ensures that death is the likely outcome for any action that irritates someone consequential.
tags.cheapLife.friends.0: Endearing local whose life the PCs accidentally bought
tags.cheapLife.friends.1: Escapee from death seeking outside help
tags.cheapLife.friends.2: Reformer trying to change local mores
tags.cheapLife.complications.0: Radiation or local diseases ensure all locals die before twenty-five years of age
tags.cheapLife.complications.1: Tech ensures that death is just an annoyance
tags.cheapLife.complications.2: Locals are totally convinced of a blissful afterlife
tags.cheapLife.things.0: Device that revives or re-embodies the dead
tags.cheapLife.things.1: Maltech engine fueled by human life
tags.cheapLife.things.2: Priceless treasure held by a now dead owner
tags.cheapLife.places.2: Factory full of lethal dangers that could be corrected easily
tags.civilWar.description: The world is currently torn between at least two opposing factions, all of which claim legitimacy. The war may be the result of a successful rebel uprising against tyranny, or it might just be the result of schemers who plan to be the new masters once the revolution is complete.
tags.civilWar.enemies.2: Conspiracy theorist who blames offwolders for the war
tags.civilWar.friends.2: Offworlder seeking passage off the planet
tags.civilWar.complications.0: The front rolls over the group
tags.civilWar.complications.2: Bandit infestations are in the way
tags.civilWar.things.2: Treasure buried for after the war
tags.coldWar.description: Two or more great powers control the planet, and they have a hostility to each other that's just barely less than open warfare. The hostility might be ideological in nature, or it might revolve around control of some local resource.
tags.coldWar.enemies.1: Native who thinks the outworlders are with the other side
tags.coldWar.friends.3: "He's a bastard, but he's our bastard" official
tags.coldWar.things.2: Huge cache of weapons built up in preparation for war
tags.coldWar.places.0: Seedy bar in a neutral area
tags.coldWar.places.2: Isolated area where fighting is underway
tags.colonizedPopulation.description: A neighboring world has successfully colonized this less-advanced or less-organized planet, and the natives aren't happy about it. A puppet government may exist, but all real decisions are made by the local viceroy.
tags.colonizedPopulation.enemies.2: Local crime boss preying on rich offworlders
tags.colonizedPopulation.friends.2: Native caught between the two sides
tags.colonizedPopulation.things.2: Precious substance extracted by colonial labor
tags.culturalPower.description: The world is a considerable cultural power in the sector, producing music, art, philosophy, or some similar intangible that their neighbors find irresistably attractive. Other worlds might have a profound degree of cultural cachet as the inheritor of some venerable artistic tradition.
tags.culturalPower.enemies.2: Failed artist with an obsessive grudge
tags.culturalPower.enemies.3: Critic with a crusade to enact
tags.culturalPower.friends.3: Offworlder hating the source of corrupting alien ways
tags.culturalPower.complications.0: The art is slowly lethal to its masters
tags.culturalPower.complications.1: The art is mentally or physically addictive
tags.culturalPower.complications.2: The art is a fragment of ancient technical or military science
tags.culturalPower.things.0: The instrument of a legendary master
tags.culturalPower.things.1: The only copy of a dead master's opus
tags.culturalPower.places.2: Monument to the dead master of the art
tags.cybercommunists.description: On this world communism actually works, thanks to pretech computing devices and greater or lesser amounts of psychic precognition. Central planning nodes direct all production and employment on the world. Citizens in good standing have access to ample amounts of material goods for all needs and many wants. Instead of strife over wealth, conflicts erupt over political controls, cultural precepts, or control over the planning nodes. Many cybercommunist worlds show a considerable bias toward the private interests of those who run the planning nodes.
tags.cybercommunists.complications.0: The pretech planning computers are breaking down
tags.cybercommunists.complications.1: The planning only works because the locals have been mentally or physically altered
tags.cybercommunists.complications.2: The planning computers can't handle the increasing population within the system
tags.cybercommunists.things.1: Wildly destabilizing commodity that can't be factored into plans
tags.cybercommunists.things.2: A tremendous store of valuables made by accident
tags.cybercommunists.places.1: Apartment block of perfectly equal flats
tags.cyborgs.description: The planet's population makes heavy use of cybernetics, with many of the inhabitants possessing at least a cosmetic amount of chrome. This may be the result of a strong local cyber tech base, a religious injunction, or simply a necessary measure to survive the local conditions.
tags.cyborgs.complications.0: The powerful and dangerous come here often for cutting-edge implants
tags.cyborgs.complications.1: The cyber has some universal negative side-effect
tags.cyborgs.complications.2: Cyber and those implanted with it are forbidden to leave the planet as a tech security measure
tags.cyborgs.things.3: A cache of critically-needed therapeutic cyber
tags.cyborgs.places.2: Stark plaza where everyone is seeing things through their augmented-reality cyber
tags.cyclicalDoom.description: The world regularly suffers some apocalyptic catastrophe that wipes out organized civilization on it. The local culture is aware of this cycle and has traditions to ensure a fragment of civilization survives into the next era, but these traditions don't always work properly, and sometimes dangerous fragments of the past emerge.
tags.cyclicalDoom.enemies.0: Offwolder seeking to trigger the apocalypse early for profit
tags.cyclicalDoom.enemies.1: Local recklessly taking advantage of preparation stores
tags.cyclicalDoom.enemies.2: Demagogue claiming the cycle is merely a myth of the authorities
tags.cyclicalDoom.friends.2: Local threatened by perils of the cycle's initial stages
tags.cyclicalDoom.complications.0: The cycles really are a myth of the authorities
tags.cyclicalDoom.complications.1: The cycles are controlled by alien constructs
tags.cyclicalDoom.complications.2: An outside power is interfering with preparation
tags.cyclicalDoom.things.0: A lost cache of ancien treasures
tags.cyclicalDoom.things.1: Tech or archives that will pinpoint the cycle's timing
tags.cyclicalDoom.things.2: Keycodes to bypass an ancient vault's security
tags.cyclicalDoom.places.2: Town existing in the shadow of some monstrous monument to a former upheaval
tags.desertWorld.description: The world may have a breathable atmosphere and a human-tolerable temperature range, but it is an arid, stony waste outside of a few places made habitable by human effort. The deep wastes are largely unexplored and inhabited by outcasts and worse.
tags.doomedWorld.description: The world is doomed, and the locals may or may not know it. Some cosmic catastrophe looms before them, and the locals have no realistic way to get everyone to safety. To the extent that the public is aware, society is disintegrating into a combination of religious fervor, abject hedonism, and savage violence.
tags.doomedWorld.enemies.1: Ruthless leader seeking to flee with their treasures
tags.doomedWorld.enemies.2: Cynical ship captain selling a one-way trip into hard vacuum as escape to another world
tags.doomedWorld.friends.0: Appealing waif or family head seeking escape
tags.doomedWorld.complications.0: The doom is false or won't actually kill everyone
tags.doomedWorld.complications.1: The doom was intentionally triggered by someone
tags.doomedWorld.complications.2: Mass escape is possible if warring groups can somehow be brought to cooperate
tags.doomedWorld.things.0: Clearance for a ship to leave the planet
tags.doomedWorld.things.1: A cache of priceless cultural artifacts
tags.doomedWorld.things.2: The life savings of someone trying to buy passage out
tags.doomedWorld.things.3: Data that would prove to the public the end is nigh
tags.doomedWorld.places.0: Open square beneath a sky angry with a foretaste of the impending doom
tags.doomedWorld.places.1: Orgiastic celebration involving sex and murder in equal parts
tags.doomedWorld.places.2: Holy site full of desperate petitioners to the divine
tags.dyingRace.description: The inhabitants of this world are dying out, and they know it. Through environmental toxins, hostile bio-weapons, or sheer societal despair, the culture cannot replenish its numbers. Members seek meaning in their own strange goals or peculiar faiths, though a few might struggle to find some way to reverse their slow yet inevitable doom.
tags.dyingRace.enemies.0: Hostile outsider who wants the locals dead
tags.dyingRace.enemies.1: Offwolder seeking to take advantage of their weakened state
tags.dyingRace.enemies.2: Invaders eager to push the locals out of their former lands
tags.dyingRace.friends.0: One of the few youth amonth the population
tags.dyingRace.friends.2: Researcher seeking a new method of reproduction
tags.dyingRace.complications.0: The dying culture's values were monstrous
tags.dyingRace.complications.1: The race's death is somehow necessary to prevent some grand catastrophe
tags.dyingRace.complications.2: The race is somehow convinced they deserve this fate
tags.dyingRace.things.1: Treasured artifacts of the former age
tags.dyingRace.places.1: Mighty edifice now crumbling with disrepair
tags.dyingRace.places.2: Small dwelling full of people in a town now otherwise empty
tags.eugenicCult.description: Even in the days before the Silence, major improvement of the human genome always seemed to come with unacceptable side-effects. Some worlds host secret cults that perpetuate these improvements regardless of the cost, and a few planets have been taken over entirely by the cults.
tags.eugenicCult.complications.1: The locals are terrified of any unusual physical appearance
tags.eugenicCult.complications.2: The genetic modifications, and drawbacks, are contagious with long exposure
tags.eugenicCult.places.2: Public place infiltrated by cult sympathizers
tags.exchangeConsulate.description: The Exchange of Light once served as the largest, most trusted banking and diplomatic service in human space. Even after the Silence, some worlds retain a functioning Exchange Consulate where banking services and arbitration can be arranged.
tags.exchangeConsulate.enemies.1: Indebted native who thinks the players are exchange agents
tags.exchangeConsulate.enemies.2: Exchange official dunning the players for debts occured
tags.exchangeConsulate.friends.0: Consul in need of offworld help
tags.exchangeConsulate.friends.1: Local banker seeking to hurt his competition
tags.exchangeConsulate.complications.0: The local consulate has been corrupted
tags.exchangeConsulate.complications.1: The consulate is cut off from its funds
tags.exchangeConsulate.complications.2: A powerful debtor refuses to pay
tags.exchangeConsulate.things.1: Wealth hidden to conceal it from a bankruptcy judgement
tags.fallenHegemon.description: At some point in the past, this world was a hegemonic power over some or all of the sector, thanks to superior tech, expert diplomacy, the weakness of their neighbors, or inherited Mandate legitimacy. Some kind of crash or revolt broke their power, however, and now the world is littered with the wreckage of former glory.
tags.fallenHegemon.enemies.0: Bitter pretender to a meaningless throne
tags.fallenHegemon.enemies.2: Vengeful offworlder seeing to punish their old rulers
tags.fallenHegemon.friends.0: Realistic local leader trying to hold things together
tags.fallenHegemon.friends.2: Refugee from an overthrown colonial enclave
tags.fallenHegemon.complications.0: The hegemon's rule was enlightened and fair
tags.fallenHegemon.complications.1: It collapsed due to its own internal strife rather than external resistance
tags.fallenHegemon.complications.2: It pretends that nothing has happened to its power
tags.fallenHegemon.complications.3: It's been counter-colonized by vengeful outsiders
tags.fallenHegemon.things.1: Relic tech important to its power
tags.fallenHegemon.places.0: Palace far too grand for its current occupant
tags.fallenHegemon.places.2: Boulevard lined with monuments to past glories
tags.feralWorld.description: In the long, isolated night of the Silence, some worlds have experienced total moral and cultural collapse. Whatever remains has been twisted beyond recognition into assorted death cults, xenophobic fanaticism, horrific cultural practices, or other behavior unacceptable on more enlightened worlds. These worlds are almost invariably quarantined by other planets.
tags.feralWorld.friends.2: Native wanting to avoid traditional flensing
tags.feralWorld.things.2: Valuable possession owned by luckless outworlder victim
tags.feralWorld.places.2: Ordinary location twisted into something terrible
tags.flyingCities.description: Perhaps the world is a gas giant, or plagued with unendurable storms at lower levels of the atmosphere. For whatever reason, the cities of this world fly above the surface of the planet. Perhaps they remain stationary, or perhaps they move from point to point in search of resources.
tags.flyingCities.enemies.1: Tech thief attempting to steal outworld gear
tags.flyingCities.enemies.2: Saboteur or scavenger plundering the city's tech
tags.flyingCities.friends.0: Maintenance tech in need of help
tags.flyingCities.places.1: The one calm place on the planet's surface
tags.flyingCities.places.2: Catwalks stretching over unimaginable gulfs below
tags.forbiddenTech.description: Some group on this planet fabricates or uses maltech. Unbraked AIs doomed to metastasize into insanity, nation-destroying nanowarfare particles, slow-burn DNA corruptives, genetically engineered slaves, or something worse still. The planet's larger population may or may not be aware of the danger in their midst.
tags.forbiddenTech.complications.0: The maltech is being fabricated by an unbraked AI
tags.forbiddenTech.complications.1: The government depends on revenue from maltech sales to offworlders
tags.forbiddenTech.complications.2: Citizens insist that it's not really maltech
tags.forbiddenTech.things.2: Precious pretech equipment used to create it
tags.forbiddenTech.places.1: Hellscape sculpted by the maltech's use
tags.formerWarriors.description: The locals of this world were once famed for their martial prowess. They may have simply had a very militaristic culture, or were genetically engineered for combat, or developed high-tech weaponry, or had brilliant leadership. Those days are past, however, either due to crushing defeat, external restrictions, or a cultural turn toward peace.
tags.formerWarriors.enemies.2: Victim of their warfare seeking revenge
tags.formerWarriors.friends.0: Partisan of the new peaceful ways
tags.formerWarriors.friends.2: Martial genius repressed by the new dispensation
tags.formerWarriors.complications.0: Neighboring worlds want them pacified or dead
tags.formerWarriors.complications.1: They only ever used their arts in self-defense
tags.formerWarriors.complications.2: The source of their gifts has been "turned off" in a reversible way
tags.formerWarriors.things.0: War trophy taken from a defeated foe
tags.formerWarriors.things.1: Key to re-activating their martial ways
tags.formerWarriors.things.2: Secret cache of high-tech military gear
tags.formerWarriors.places.1: Memorial hall now left to dust and silence
tags.formerWarriors.places.2: Monument plaza dedicated to the new culture
tags.freakGeology.description: The geology or geography of this world is simply freakish. Perhaps it's composed entirely of enormous mountain ranges, or regular bands of land and sea, or the mineral structures all fragment into perfect cubes. The locals have learned to deal with it and their culture will be shaped by its requirements.
tags.freakGeology.enemies.1:
Cultist who believes it the
work of aliens
tags.freakGeology.complications.0: Local conditions that no one remembers to tell offworlders about
tags.freakGeology.things.1: Hidden veins of a major precious mineral strike
tags.freakGeology.things.2: Deed to a location of great natural beauty
tags.freakWeather.description: The planet is plagued with some sort of bizarre or hazardous weather pattern. Perhaps city-flattening storms regularly scourge the surface, or the world's sun never pierces its thick banks of clouds.
tags.freakWeather.enemies.0: Criminal using the weather as a cover
tags.freakWeather.enemies.1: Weather cultists convinced the offworlders are responsible for some disaster
tags.freakWeather.enemies.2: Native predators dependent on the weather
tags.freakWeather.friends.1: Holodoc crew wanting shots of the weather
tags.freakWeather.complications.1:
Malfunctioning pretech terraforming
engines that cause the weather
tags.freakWeather.things.1: Holorecords of a spectacularly and rare weather pattern
tags.friendlyFoe.description: Some hostile alien race or malevolent cabal has a branch or sect on this world that is actually quite friendly toward outsiders. For whatever internal reason, they are willing to negotiate and deal honestly with strangers, and appear to lack the worst impulses of their fellows.
tags.friendlyFoe.enemies.0: Driven hater of all their kind
tags.friendlyFoe.enemies.1: Internal malcontent bent on creating conflict
tags.friendlyFoe.enemies.2: Secret master who seeks to lure trust
tags.friendlyFoe.complications.0: The group actually is a harmless and benevolent as they seem
tags.friendlyFoe.complications.1: The group offers a vital service at the cost of moral compromise
tags.friendlyFoe.complications.2: The group still feels bonds of affiliation with their hostile brethren
tags.friendlyFoe.things.2: Evidence to convince others of their kind they are right
tags.goldRush.description: Gold, silver, and other conventional precious minerals are common and cheap now that asteroid mining is practical for most worlds. But some minerals and compounds remain precious and rare, and this world has recently been discovered to have a supply of them. People from across the sector have come to strike it rich.
tags.goldRush.complications.1: The strike is of a dangerous toxic substance
tags.goldRush.complications.2: Export of the mineral is prohibited by the planetary government
tags.goldRush.complications.3: The native aliens live around the strike's location
tags.greatWork.description: The locals are obsessed with completing a massive project, one that has consumed them for generations. It might be the completion of a functioning spaceyard, a massive solar power array, a network of terraforming engines, or the universal conversion of their neighbors to their own faith. The purpose of their entire civilization is to progress and some day complete the work.
tags.greatWork.enemies.0: Local planning to sacrifice the PCs for the work
tags.greatWork.enemies.1: Local who thinks the PCs threaten the work
tags.greatWork.enemies.2: Obsessive zealot ready to destroy someone or something important to the PCs for the sake of the work
tags.greatWork.friends.1: Local with a more temperate attitude
tags.greatWork.complications.1: Different factions disagree on what the work is
tags.greatWork.complications.2: An outside power is determined to thwart the work
tags.greatWork.things.2: Tech that greatly speeds the work
tags.greatWork.places.2: Local community made only semi-livable by the demands of the work
tags.hatred.description: For whatever reason, this world's populace has a burning hatred for the inhabitants of a neighboring system. Perhaps this world was colonized by exiles, or there was a recent interstellar war, or ideas of racial or religious superiority have fanned the hatred. Regardless of the cause, the locals view their neighbor and any sympathizers with loathing.
tags.hatred.enemies.0: Native convinced that the offworlders are agents of Them
tags.hatred.enemies.1: Cynical politician in need of scapegoats
tags.hatred.friends.2: Unlucky offworlder from the hated system
tags.hatred.complications.0: The characters are wearing or using items from the hated world
tags.hatred.complications.1: The characters are known to have done business there
tags.hatred.complications.2: The characters "look like" the hated others
tags.hatred.things.1: Reward for turning in enemy agents
tags.hatred.things.2: Relic stolen by Them years ago
tags.hatred.places.2: Captured and decommissioned spaceship kept as a trophy
tags.heavyIndustry.description: With interstellar transport so limited in the bulk it can move, worlds have to be largely self-sufficient in industry. Some worlds are more sufficient than others, however, and this planet has a thriving manufacturing sector capable of producing large amounts of goods appropriate to its tech level. The locals may enjoy a correspondingly higher lifestyle, or the products might be devoted towards vast projects for the aggrandizement of the rulers.
tags.heavyIndustry.complications.1: The resources extractable at their tech level are running out
tags.heavyIndustry.complications.2: The masses required the factory output for survival
tags.heavyIndustry.complications.3: The industries' major output is being obsoleted by offworld tech
tags.heavyIndustry.things.2: Ownership shares in an industrial complex
tags.heavyMining.description: This world has large stocks of valuable minerals, usually necessary for local industry, life support, or refinement into loads small enough to export offworld. Major mining efforts are necessary to extract the minerals, and many natives work in the industry.
tags.heavyMining.complications.2: Silicate life forms growing in the miner's lungs
tags.hivemind.description: Natives of this world exist in a kind of mental gestalt, sharing thoughts and partaking of a single identity. Powerful pretech, exotic psionics, alien influence, or some other cause has left the world sharing one identity. Individual members may have greater or lesser degrees of effective coordination with the whole.
tags.hivemind.enemies.0: A hivemind that wants to assimilate outsiders
tags.hivemind.enemies.1: A hivemind that has no respect for unjoined life
tags.hivemind.enemies.2: A hivemind that fears and hates unjoined life
tags.hivemind.friends.1: A person severed from the gestalt
tags.hivemind.friends.2: A relative of someone who has been assimilated
tags.hivemind.complications.0: The hivemind only functions on this world
tags.hivemind.complications.1: The hivemind has strict range limits
tags.hivemind.complications.2: The hivemind has different personality factions
tags.hivemind.complications.3: The hivemind only happens at particular times
tags.hivemind.complications.4: The world is made of semi-sentient drones and a single AI
tags.hivemind.things.0: Vital tech for maintaining the mind
tags.hivemind.things.1: Precious treasure held by now-assimilated outsider
tags.hivemind.things.2: Tech that "blinds" the hivemind ot the tech's users
tags.hivemind.places.0: Barely tolerable living cells for individuals
tags.hivemind.places.1: Workside where individuals casually die in their labors
tags.hivemind.places.2: Community with absolutely no social or group-gathering facilities
tags.holyWar.description: A savage holy war is raging on this world, either between factions of locals or as a united effort against the pagans of some neighboring world. This war might involve a conventional religion, or it might be the result of a branding campaign, political ideology, artistic movement, or any other cause that people use as a substitute for traditional religion.
tags.holyWar.friends.2: Peaceful religious leader who lost the internal debate
tags.holyWar.complications.0: The targets of the war really are doing something diabolically horrible
tags.holyWar.complications.1: The holy war is just a mask for a very traditional casus belli
tags.holyWar.complications.2: The leaders don't want the war won but only prolonged
tags.holyWar.complications.3: Both this world and the target of the war are religious-obsessed
tags.holyWar.things.1: A captured blasphemer under a death sentence
tags.holyWar.places.2: Vast shrine to the martyrs dead in war
tags.hostileBiosphere.description: The world is teeming with life, and it hates humans. Perhaps the life is xenoallergenic, forcing filter masks and tailored antiallergens for survival. It could be the native predators are huge and fearless, or the toxic flora ruthlessly outcompetes earth crops.
tags.hostileSpace.description: The system in which the world exists is a dangerous neighborhood. Something about the system is perilous to inhabitants, either through meteor swarms, stellar radiation, hostile aliens in the asteroid belt, or periodic comet clouds.
tags.hostileSpace.complications.0: The natives believe the danger is divine chastisement
tags.hostileSpace.complications.1: The natives blame outworlders for the danger
tags.hostileSpace.complications.2: The native elite profit from the danger in some way
tags.hostileSpace.things.0: Early warning of a raid or impact
tags.hostileSpace.things.1: Abandoned riches in a disaster zone
tags.hostileSpace.places.1: Village burnt in an alien raid
tags.immortals.description: Natives of this world are effectively immortal. They may have been gengineered for tremendous lifespans, or have found some local anagathic, or be cyborg life forms, or be so totally convinced of reincarnation that death is a cultural irrelevance. Any immortality technique is likely applicable only to them, or else it's apt to be a massive draw to outside imperialists.
tags.immortals.enemies.1: Smug local convinced of their immortal wisdom to rule all
tags.immortals.enemies.2: Offworlder seeking the world's ruin before it becomes a threat to all
tags.immortals.complications.0: Immortality requires doing something that outsiders can't or won't willingly do
tags.immortals.complications.1: The immortality ends if they leave the world
tags.immortals.complications.2: Death is the punishment for even minor crimes
tags.immortals.complications.3: Immortals must die or go offworld after a certain span
tags.immortals.places.1: Unchanging structure of obvious ancient age
tags.immortals.places.2: Cultural performance relying on a century of in-jokes
tags.localSpecialty.description: The world may be sophisticated or barely capable of steam engines, but either way it produces something rare and precious to the wider galaxy. It might be some pharmaceutical extract produced by a secret recipe, a remarkably popular cultural product, or even gengineered humans uniquely suited for certain work.
tags.localSpecialty.enemies.1: Offworlder seeking prohibition of the specialty
tags.localSpecialty.enemies.2: Native who views the specialty as sacred
tags.localSpecialty.complications.0: The specialty is repugnant in nature
tags.localSpecialty.complications.1: The crafters refuse to sell to offworlders
tags.localSpecialty.complications.2: The specialty is made in a remote, dangerous place
tags.localSpecialty.complications.3: The crafters don't make the specialty any more
tags.localSpecialty.things.2: Sample of a new improved variety
tags.localTech.description: The locals can create a particular example of extremely high tech, possibly even something that exceeds pretech standards. They may use unique local resources to do so, or have stumbled on a narrow scientific breakthrough, or still have a functional experimental manufactory.
tags.localTech.enemies.2: Automated defenses that suddenly come alive
tags.localTech.friends.2: Native in need of technical help
tags.localTech.complications.1: The tech only works on this world
tags.localTech.complications.2: The tech has poorly-understood side effects
tags.localTech.complications.3: The tech is alien in nature
tags.localTech.things.1: An unclaimed payment for a large shipment
tags.localTech.things.2: The secret blueprints for its construction
tags.majorSpaceyard.description: Most worlds of tech level 4 or greater have the necessary tech and orbital facilities to build spike drives and starships. This world is blessed with a major spaceyard facility, either inherited from before the Silence or painstakingly constructed in more recent decades. It can build even capital-class hulls, and do so more quickly and cheaply than its neighbors.
tags.majorSpaceyard.complications.0: The spaceyard is an alien relic
tags.majorSpaceyard.complications.1: The spaceyard is burning out from overuse
tags.majorSpaceyard.complications.3: The spaceyard relies on maltech to function
tags.majorSpaceyard.things.1: Override keys for activating old pretech facilities
tags.mandarinate.description: The planet is ruled by an intellectual elite chosen via ostensibly neutral examinations or tests. The values this system selects for may or may not have anything to do with actual practical leadership skills, and the examinations may be more or less corruptible.
tags.mandarinate.enemies.2: Ruthless leader of a clan of high-testing relations
tags.mandarinate.complications.0: The test is totally unrelated to necessary governing skills
tags.mandarinate.complications.1: The test was very pertinent in the past but tech or culture has changes
tags.mandarinate.complications.2: The test is for a skill that is vital to maintaining society but irrelevant to day-to-day governance
tags.mandarinate.complications.3: The test is a sham and passage is based on wealth or influence
tags.mandarinate.things.0: Answer key to the next test
tags.mandarinate.places.0: Massive structure full of test-taking cubicles
tags.mandarinate.places.2: Ornate government building decorated with scholarly quotes and academic images
tags.mandateBase.description: The Terran Mandate retained its control over this world for much longer than usual, and the world may still consider itself a true inheritor of Mandate legitimacy. Most of these worlds have or had superior technology, but they may still labor under the burden of ancient restrictive tech or monitoring systems designed to prevent them from rebelling.
tags.mandateBase.enemies.2: Demagogue preaching local superiority over "traitorous rebel worlds"
tags.mandateBase.friends.2: Outsider seeking lost data from Mandate records
tags.mandateBase.complications.0: The monitoring system forces the locals to behave in aggressive ways toward "rebel" worlds
tags.mandateBase.complications.1: The monitoring system severely hinders offworld use of their tech
tags.mandateBase.complications.2: The original colonists are all dead and have been replaced by outsiders who don't understand all the details
tags.mandateBase.places.0: Faded Mandate offices still in use
tags.maneaters.description: The locals are cannibals, either out of necessity or out of cultural preference. Some worlds may actually eat human flesh, while others simply require the rendering of humans into important chemicals or pharmaceutical compounds, perhaps to prolong the lives of ghoul overlords. This cannibalism plays a major role in their society.
tags.maneaters.enemies.2: Sophisticated degenerate preaching the splendid authenticity of cannibalism
tags.maneaters.friends.1: Escapee from a pharmaceutical rendering plant
tags.maneaters.friends.2: Reformer seeking to break the custom or its necessity
tags.maneaters.complications.0: Local food or environmental conditions make human consumption grimly necessary
tags.maneaters.complications.2: Outsiders are expected to join in the custom
tags.maneaters.complications.3: The custom is totally unnecessary but jealously maintained by the people
tags.maneaters.things.1: An offworlder VIP due for the menu
tags.maneaters.things.2: A toxin that makes human flesh lethal to consumers
tags.megacorps.description: The world is dominated by classic cyberpunk-esque megacorporations, each one far more important than the vestigial national remnants that encompass them. These megacorps are usually locked in a cold war, trading and dealing with each other even as they try to strike in deniable ways. An over-council of corporations usually acts to bring into line any that get excessively overt in their activities.
tags.megacorps.enemies.1: Underling looking to use the PCs as catspaws
tags.megacorps.enemies.2: Ruthless mercenary who wants what the PCs have
tags.megacorps.friends.1: Offworlder merchant in far over their head
tags.megacorps.friends.2: Local reformer struggling to cope with megacorp indifference
tags.megacorps.complications.0: The megacorps are the only source of something vital to life on this world
tags.megacorps.complications.1: An autonomous Mandate system acts to punish excessively overt violence
tags.megacorps.complications.2: The megacorps are struggling against much more horrible national governments
tags.megacorps.things.2: Proof of corp responsibility for a heinously unacceptable public atrocity
tags.megacorps.things.3: Data on a vital new product line coming out soon
tags.megacorps.places.0: A place plastered in megacorp ads
tags.mercenaries.description: The world is either famous for its mercenary bands or it is plagued by countless groups of condottieri in service to whatever magnate can afford to pay or bribe them adequately.
tags.mercenaries.enemies.1: Rich offworlder trying to buy rule of the world
tags.mercenaries.enemies.2: Mercenary press gang chief forcing locals into service
tags.mercenaries.friends.1: Harried leader of enfeebled national army
tags.mercenaries.friends.2: Offworlder trying to hire help for a noble cause
tags.mercenaries.complications.0: The mercenaries are all that stand between the locals and a hungry imperial power
tags.mercenaries.complications.1: The mercenaries are remnants of a former official army
tags.mercenaries.complications.2: The mercenaries hardly ever actually fight as compared to taking bribes to walk away
tags.mercenaries.things.2: Proof of a band's impending treachery against their employers
tags.mercenaries.places.2: Luxurious and exceedingly well-defended merc leader villa
tags.minimalContact.description: The locals refuse most contact with offworlders. Only a small, quarantined treaty port is provided for offworld trade, and ships can expect an exhaustive search for contraband. Local governments may be trying to keep the very existence of interstellar trade a secret from their populations, or they may simply consider offworlders too dangerous or repugnant to be allowed among the population.
tags.minimalContact.enemies.2: Existing merchant who doesn't like competition
tags.minimalContact.complications.0: The locals carry a disease harmless to them and lethal to outsiders
tags.minimalContact.complications.1: The locals hide dark purposes from offworlders
tags.minimalContact.complications.2: The locals have something desperately needed but won't bring it into the treaty port
tags.misandryMisogyny.description: The culture on this world holds a particular gender in contempt. Members of that gender are not permitted positions of formal power, and may be restricted in their movements and activities. Some worlds may go so far as to scorn both traditional genders, using gengineering techniques to hybridize or alter conventional human biology.
tags.misandryMisogyny.enemies.2: Local rebel driven to pointless and meaningless violence
tags.misandryMisogyny.complications.0: The oppressed gender is restive against the customs
tags.misandryMisogyny.complications.1: The oppressed gender largely supports the customs
tags.misandryMisogyny.complications.2: The customs relate to some physical quality of the world
tags.misandryMisogyny.complications.3: The oppressed gender has had maltech gengineering done to "tame" them
tags.misandryMisogyny.things.0: Aerosol reversion formula for undoing genginerring docility
tags.misandryMisogyny.places.0: Shrine to the virtues of the favored gender
tags.misandryMisogyny.places.1: Security center for controlling the oppressed
tags.nightWorld.description: The world is plunged into eternal darkness. The only life on this planet derives its energy from other sources, such as geothermal heat, extremely volatile chemical reactions in the planet's soil, or light in a non-visible spectrum. Most flora and fauna is voraciously eager to consume other life.
tags.nightWorld.enemies.1: Offworlder finding the obscurity of the world convenient for dark purposes
tags.nightWorld.enemies.2: Mad scientist experimenting with local life
tags.nightWorld.friends.2: High priest of a sect that finds religious significance in the night
tags.nightWorld.complications.0: Daylight comes as a cataclysmic event at very long intervals
tags.nightWorld.complications.1: Light causes very dangerous reactions to native life or chemicals here
tags.nightWorld.complications.2: The locals have been gengineered to exist without light
tags.nightWorld.things.0: Rare chemicals created in the darkness
tags.nightWorld.things.1: Light source usable on this world
tags.nightWorld.things.2: Smuggler cache hidden here in ages past
tags.nightWorld.places.2: Location defined by sounds or smells
tags.nomads.description: Most of the natives of this world are nomadic, usually following a traditional cycle of movement through the lands they possess. Promises of rich plunder or local environmental perils can force these groups to strike out against neighbors. Other groups are forced to move constantly due to unpredictable dangers that crop up on the planet.
tags.nomads.enemies.0: Desperate tribal leader who needs what the PCs have
tags.nomads.enemies.2: Leader seeking to weld the nomads into an army
tags.nomads.complications.0: An irresistibly lethal swarm of native life forces locals to move regularly
tags.nomads.complications.1: Ancient defense systems destroy too-long-stationary communities
tags.nomads.complications.2: Local chemical patches require careful balancing of exposure times to avoid side effects
tags.nomads.things.0: Cache of rare and precious resource
tags.nomads.things.1: Plunder seized by a tribal raid
tags.nomads.things.2: Tech that makes a place safe for long-term inhabitation
tags.nomads.places.2: Trackless waste that kills the unprepared
tags.oceanicWorld.description: The world is entirely or almost entirely covered with liquid water. Habitations might be floating cities, or might cling precariously to the few rocky atolls jutting up from the waves, or are planted as bubbles on promontories deep beneath the stormy surface. Survival depends on aquaculture. Planets with inedible alien life rely on gengineered Terran sea crops.
tags.oceanicWorld.complications.0: The liquid flux confuses grav engines too badly for them to function on this world
tags.oceanicWorld.complications.2: The seas are wracked by regular storms
tags.oceanicWorld.things.1: Location of enormous schools of fish
tags.oceanicWorld.places.0: The only island on the planet
tags.outOfContact.description: The natives have been entirely out of contact with the greater galaxy for centuries or longer. Perhaps the original colonists were seeking to hide from the rest of the universe, or the Silence destroyed any means of communication. It may have been so long that human origins on other worlds have regressed into a topic for legends. The players might be on the first offworld ship to land since the First Wave of colonization a thousand years ago.
tags.outOfContact.enemies.2: Sinister power that has kept the world isolated
tags.outOfContact.complications.0: Automated defenses fire on ships that try to take off
tags.outOfContact.complications.1: The natives want to stay out of contact
tags.outOfContact.complications.2: The natives are highly vulnerable to offworld diseases
tags.outOfContact.complications.3: The native language is completely unlike any known to the group
tags.outpostWorld.description: The world is only a tiny outpost of human habitation planted by an offworld corporation or government. Perhaps the staff is there to serve as a refueling and repair stop for passing ships, or to oversee an automated mining and refinery complex. They might be there to study ancient ruins, or simply serve as a listening and monitoring post for traffic through the system. The outpost is likely well-equipped with defenses against casual piracy.
tags.outpostWorld.enemies.1: Outpost commander who wants it to stay undiscovered
tags.outpostWorld.complications.0: The alien ruin defense systems are waking up
tags.outpostWorld.complications.1: Atmospheric disturbances trap the group inside the outpost for a month
tags.outpostWorld.complications.3: The crew have become converts to a strange set of beliefs
tags.outpostWorld.places.2: The only building on the planet
tags.perimeterAgency.description: Before the Silence, the Perimeter was a Terran-sponsored organization charged with rooting out use of maltech technology banned in human space as too dangerous for use or experimentation. Unbraked AIs, gengineered slave species, nanotech replicators, weapons of planetary destruction... the Perimeter hunted down experimenters with a great indifference to planetary laws. Most Perimeter Agencies collapsed during the Silence, but a few managed to hold on to their mission, though modern Perimeter agents often find more work as conventional spies.
tags.perimeterAgency.complications.0: The local agency has gone rogue and now uses maltech
tags.perimeterAgency.complications.1: The Agency archives have been compromised
tags.perimeterAgency.complications.2: The Agency has been targeted by a maltech-using organization
tags.perimeterAgency.complications.3: The Agency's existence is unknown to the locals
tags.perimeterAgency.things.2: File of blackmail on local politicians
tags.pilgrimageSite.description: The world is noted for an important spiritual or historical location, and might be the sector headquarters for a widespread religion or political movement. The site attracts wealthy pilgrims from throughout nearby space, and those with the money necessary to manage interstellar travel can be quite generous to the site and its keepers. The locals tend to be fiercely protective of the place and its reputation, and some places may forbid the entrance of those not suitably pious or devout.
tags.pilgrimageSite.enemies.0: Saboteur devoted to a rival rival belief
tags.pilgrimageSite.enemies.1: Bitter reformer who resents the current leadership
tags.pilgrimageSite.friends.2: Outsider wanting to learn the sanctum's inner secrets
tags.pilgrimageSite.complications.0: The site is actually a fake
tags.pilgrimageSite.complications.1: The site is run by corrupt and venal keepers
tags.pilgrimageSite.complications.2: A natural disaster threatens the site
tags.pilgrimageSite.things.0: Ancient relic guarded at the site
tags.pleasureWorld.description: This world provides delights either rare or impermissible elsewhere. Matchless local beauty, stunningly gengineered natives, a wide variety of local drugs, carnal pleasures unacceptable on other worlds, or some other rare delight is readily available here. Most worlds are fully aware of the value of their offerings, and the prices they demand can be in credits or in less tangible recompense.
tags.pleasureWorld.enemies.1: Local seeking to control others with addictions
tags.pleasureWorld.friends.1: Native seeking a more meaningful life elsewhere
tags.pleasureWorld.friends.2: Offworld entertainer looking for training here
tags.pleasureWorld.complications.0: A deeply repugnant pleasure is offered here by a culture that sees nothing wrong with it
tags.pleasureWorld.complications.1: Certain pleasures here are dangerously addictive
tags.pleasureWorld.complications.2: The prices here can involve enslavement or death
tags.pleasureWorld.complications.3: The world has been seized and exploited by an imperial power
tags.pleasureWorld.things.1: A contract for some unspeakable payment
tags.pleasureWorld.things.2: Powerful tech repurposed for hedonistic ends
tags.policeState.description: The world is a totalitarian police state. Any sign of disloyalty to the planet's rulers is punished severely, and suspicion riddles society. Some worlds might operate by Soviet-style informers and indoctrination, while more technically sophisticated worlds might rely on omnipresent cameras or braked AI guardian angels. Outworlders are apt to be treated as a necessary evil at best, and disappeared if they become troublesome.
tags.policeState.complications.0: The natives largely believe in the righteousness of the state
tags.policeState.complications.1: The police state is automated and its "rulers" can't shut it off'
tags.policeState.complications.2: The leaders forment a pogrom against "offworlder spies"
tags.policeState.things.1: Wealth taken from "enemies of the state"
tags.postScarcity.description: The locals have maintained sufficient Mandate-era tech to be effectively post-scarcity in their economic structure. Everyone has all the necessities and most of the desires they can imagine. Conflict now exists over the apportionment of services and terrestrial space, since anything else can be had in abundance. Military goods and items of mass destruction may still be restricted, and there is probably some reason that the locals do not export their vast wealth.
tags.postScarcity.enemies.0: Frenzied ideologue fighting over an idea
tags.postScarcity.enemies.2: Grim reformer seeking the destruction of the "enfeebling" productive tech
tags.postScarcity.friends.0: Offworlder seeking something available only here
tags.postScarcity.friends.1: Local struggling to maintain the production tech
tags.postScarcity.friends.2: Native missionary seeking to bring abundance to other worlds
tags.postScarcity.complications.0: The tech causes serious side-effects on those who take advantage of it
tags.postScarcity.complications.2: The population is growing too large
tags.postScarcity.complications.3: The tech produces only certain things in abundance
tags.postScarcity.things.1: A rare commodity that cannot be duplicated
tags.preceptorArchive.description: The Preceptors of the Great Archive were a pre-Silence organization devoted to ensuring the dissemination of human culture, history, and basic technology to frontier worlds that risked losing this information during the human expansion. Most frontier planets had an Archive where natives could learn useful technical skills in addition to human history and art. Those Archives that managed to survive the Silence now strive to send their missionaries of knowledge to new worlds in need of their lore.
tags.preceptorArchive.enemies.1: Offworld merchant who wants the natives kept ignorant
tags.preceptorArchive.enemies.3: Corrupted first speaker who wants to keep a monopoly on learning
tags.preceptorArchive.complications.0: The local Archive has taken a religious and mystical attitude toward their teaching
tags.preceptorArchive.complications.1: The Archive has maintained some replicable pretech science
tags.preceptorArchive.complications.2: The Archive has been corrupted and their teaching is incorrect
tags.pretechCultists.description: The capacities of human science before the Silence vastly outmatch the technology available since the Scream. The jump gates alone were capable of crossing hundreds of light years in a moment, and they were just one example of the results won by blending psychic artifice with pretech science. Some worlds outright worship the artifacts of their ancestors, seeing in them the work of more enlightened and perfect humanity. These cultists may or may not understand the operation or replication of these devices, but they seek and guard them jealously.
tags.pretechCultists.complications.0: The cultists can actually replicate certain forms of pretech
tags.pretechCultists.complications.1: The cultists abhor use of the devices as "presumption on the holy"
tags.pretechCultists.complications.2: The cultists mistake the party's belongings for pretech
tags.pretechCultists.things.0: Pretech artifacts both functional and broken
tags.pretechCultists.places.2: Public procession showing a prized artifact
tags.primitiveAliens.description: The world is populated by a large number of sapient aliens that have yet to develop advanced technology. The human colonists may have a friendly or hostile relationship with the aliens, but a certain intrinsic tension is likely. Small human colonies might have been enslaved or otherwise subjugated.
tags.primitiveAliens.complications.0: The alien numbers are huge and can overwhelm the humans whenever they so choose
tags.primitiveAliens.complications.1: One group is trying to use the other to kill their political opponents
tags.prisonPlanet.description: This planet is or was intended as a prison. Some such prisons were meant for specific malefactors of the Terran Mandate, while others were to contain entire "dangerous" ethnic groups or alien races. Some may still have warden AIs or automatic systems to prevent any unauthorized person from leaving, and any authorization permits have long since expired.
tags.prisonPlanet.enemies.2: Offworlder who's somehow acquired warden powers and exploits the locals
tags.prisonPlanet.friends.1: Native technician forced to maintain the very tech that imprisons them
tags.prisonPlanet.complications.0: Departure permits are a precious currency
tags.prisonPlanet.complications.1: The prison industry still makes valuable pretech devices
tags.prisonPlanet.complications.3: The local nobility descended from the prison staff
tags.prisonPlanet.things.1: A key to bypass ancient security devices
tags.prisonPlanet.things.2: Contraband forbidden by the security scanners
tags.prisonPlanet.places.0: Mandate-era prison block converted to government building
tags.prisonPlanet.places.1: Industrial facility manned by mandatory numbers of prisoners
tags.prisonPlanet.places.2: Makeshift shop where contraband is assembled
tags.psionicsAcademy.description: This world is one of the few that have managed to redevelop the basics of psychic training. Without this education, a potential psychic is doomed to either madness or death unless they refrain from using their abilities. Psionic academies are rare enough that offworlders are often sent there to study by wealthy patrons. The secrets of psychic mentorship, the protocols and techniques that allow a psychic to successfully train another, are carefully guarded at these academies. Most are closely affiliated with the planetary government.
tags.psionicsAcademy.complications.0: The academy curriculum kills a significant percentage of students
tags.psionicsAcademy.complications.1: The faculty use students as research subjects
tags.psionicsAcademy.complications.2: The students are indoctrinated as sleeper agents
tags.psionicsAcademy.complications.3: The local natives hate the academy
tags.psionicsAcademy.complications.4: The academy is part of a religion
tags.psionicsFear.description: The locals are terrified of psychics. Perhaps their history is studded with feral psychics who went on murderous rampages, or perhaps they simply nurse an unreasoning terror of those mutant freaks. Psychics demonstrate their powers at risk of their lives.
tags.psionicsFear.complications.0: Psychic potential is much more common here
tags.psionicsFear.complications.1: Some tech is mistaken as psitech
tags.psionicsFear.complications.2: Natives believe certain rituals and customs can protect them from psychic powers
tags.psionicsFear.things.2: Reward for turning in a psychic
tags.psionicsWorship.description: These natives view psionic powers as a visible gift of god or sign of superiority. If the world has a functional psychic training academy, psychics occupy almost all major positions of power and are considered the natural and proper rulers of the world. If the world lacks training facilities, it is likely a hodgepodge of demented cults, with each one dedicated to a marginally-coherent feral prophet and their psychopathic ravings.
tags.psionicsWorship.complications.0: The psychic training is imperfect and the psychics all show significant mental illness
tags.psionicsWorship.complications.1: The psychics have developed a unique discipline
tags.psionicsWorship.complications.2: The will of a psychic is law
tags.psionicsWorship.complications.3: Psychics in the party are forcibly kidnapped for "enlightening"
tags.quarantinedWorld.description: The world is under a quarantine, and space travel to and from it is strictly forbidden. This may be enforced by massive ground batteries that burn any interlopers from the planet's sky, or it may be that a neighboring world runs a persistent blockade.
tags.quarantinedWorld.friends.0: Relative of a person trapped on the world
tags.quarantinedWorld.complications.0: The natives want to remain isolated
tags.quarantinedWorld.complications.1: The quarantine is enforced by an ancient alien installation
tags.quarantinedWorld.complications.2: The world is rife with maltech abominations
tags.quarantinedWorld.complications.3: The blockade is meant to starve everyone on the barren world
tags.radioactiveWorld.description: Whether due to a legacy of atomic warfare unhindered by nuke snuffers or a simple profusion of radioactive elements, this world glows in the dark. Even heavy vacc suits can filter only so much of the radiation, and most natives suffer a wide variety of cancers, mutations and other illnesses without the protection of advanced medical treatments.
tags.radioactiveWorld.complications.0: The radioactivity is steadily growing worse
tags.radioactiveWorld.complications.1: The planet's medical resources break down
tags.radioactiveWorld.complications.2: The radioactivity has inexplicable effects on living creatures
tags.radioactiveWorld.complications.3: The radioactivity is the product of a malfunctioning pretech manufactory
tags.refugees.description: The world teems with refugees, either exiles from another planet who managed to get here, or the human detritus of some local conflict that have fled to the remaining stable states. The natives usually regard the refugees with hostility, an attitude returned by many among their unwilling guests.
tags.refugees.enemies.1: Refugee chief aspiring to seize the host nation
tags.refugees.enemies.2: Politician seeking to use the refugees as a weapon
tags.refugees.complications.0: The xenophobes are right that the refugees are taking over
tags.refugees.complications.1: The refugees are right that the xenophobes want them out or dead
tags.refugees.complications.3: Outside powers are using the refugees to destabilize an enemy government
tags.refugees.complications.4: Refugee and local cultures are extremely incompatible
tags.refugees.things.0: Treasures brought out by fleeing refugees
tags.regionalHegemon.description: This world has the technological sophistication, natural resources, and determined polity necessary to be a regional hegemon for the sector. Nearby worlds are likely either directly subservient to it or tack carefully to avoid its anger. It may even be the capital of a small stellar empire.
tags.regionalHegemon.complications.0: The hegemon's influence is all that's keeping a murderous war from breaking out on nearby worlds
tags.regionalHegemon.complications.1: The hegemon is decaying and losing its control
tags.regionalHegemon.complications.2: The government is riddled with spies
tags.restrictiveLaws.description: A myriad of laws, customs, and rules constrain the inhabitants of this world, and even acts that are completely permissible elsewhere are punished severely here. The locals may provide lists of these laws to offworlders, but few non-natives can hope to master all the important intricacies.
tags.restrictiveLaws.enemies.2: Native lawyer specializing in peeling offworlders
tags.restrictiveLaws.complications.0: The laws change regularly in patterns only natives understand
tags.restrictiveLaws.complications.1: The laws forbid some action vital to the party
tags.restrictiveLaws.complications.2: The laws forbid the simple existence of some party members
tags.restrictiveLaws.complications.3: The laws are secret to offworlders
tags.revanchists.description: The locals formerly owned another world, or a major nation on the planet formerly owned an additional region of land. Something happened to take away this control or drive out the former rulers, and they've never forgotten it. The locals are obsessed with reclaiming their lost lands, and will allow no questions of practicality to interfere with their cause.
tags.revanchists.enemies.0: Demagogue whipping the locals on to a hopeless war
tags.revanchists.enemies.1: Politician seeking to use the resentment for their own ends
tags.revanchists.enemies.2: Local convinced the pcs are agents of the "thieving" power
tags.revanchists.enemies.3: Refugee from the land bitterly demanding it be reclaimed
tags.revanchists.friends.1: Politician trying to calm the public
tags.revanchists.friends.2: Third-party diplomat trying to stamp out the fire
tags.revanchists.complications.0: The revanchists' claim is completely just and reasonable
tags.revanchists.complications.1: The land is now occupied entirely by heirs of the conquerors
tags.revanchists.complications.2: Both sides have seized lands the other thinks are theirs
tags.revanchists.things.0: Stock of vital resource produced by the taken land
tags.revanchists.things.2: Proof that the land claim is justified or unjustified
tags.revanchists.places.1: Cemetery of those who died in the conquest
tags.revolutionaries.description: The world is convulsed by one or more bands of revolutionaries, with some nations perhaps in the grip of a current revolution. Most of these upheavals can be expected only to change the general flavor of problems in the polity, but the process of getting there usually produces a tremendous amount of suffering.
tags.revolutionaries.enemies.2: Hostile foreign agent seeking further turmoil
tags.revolutionaries.friends.0: Sympathetic victim accused of revolutionary sympathies or government collaboration
tags.revolutionaries.friends.1: Revolutionary or state agent who now repents
tags.revolutionaries.friends.2: Agent of a neutral power that wants peace
tags.revolutionaries.complications.0: The revolutionaries actually do seem likely to put in better rulers
tags.revolutionaries.complications.1: The revolutionaries are client groups that got out of hand
tags.revolutionaries.complications.2: The revolutionaries are clearly much worse than the government
tags.revolutionaries.complications.3: The revolutionaries have no real ideals beyond power and merely pretend to ideology
tags.revolutionaries.places.2: Revolutionary base hidden in the wilderness
tags.rigidCulture.description: The local culture is extremely rigid. Certain forms of behavior and belief are absolutely mandated, and any deviation from these principles is punished, or else society may be strongly stratified by birth with limited prospects for change. Anything which threatens the existing social order is feared and shunned.
tags.rigidCulture.complications.0: The cultural patterns are enforced by technological aids
tags.rigidCulture.complications.1: The culture is run by a secret cabal of manipulators
tags.rigidCulture.complications.2: The culture has explicit religious sanction
tags.rigidCulture.complications.3: The culture evolved due to important necessities that have since been forgotten
tags.rigidCulture.things.2: Opulent treasures of the ruling class
tags.risingHegemon.description: This world is not yet a dominant power in the sector, but it's well on its way there. Whether through newly-blossoming economic, military, or cultural power, they're extending their influence over their neighbors and forging new arrangements between their government and the rulers of nearby worlds.
tags.risingHegemon.friends.2: Foreign visitor seeking contracts or knowledge
tags.risingHegemon.complications.0: They're only strong because their neighbors have been weakened
tags.risingHegemon.complications.1: Their success is based on a fluke resource or pretech find
tags.risingHegemon.complications.2: They bitterly resent their neighbors as former oppressors
tags.risingHegemon.things.1: Factory or barracks emblematic of their power source
tags.risingHegemon.things.2: Tech or data that will deal a blow to their rise
tags.risingHegemon.places.0: Rustic town being hurled into prosperity
tags.risingHegemon.places.2: Starport struggling under the flow of new ships
tags.ritualCombat.description: The locals favor some form of stylized combat to resolve disputes, provide entertainment, or settle religious differences. This combat is probably not normally lethal unless it's reserved for a specific disposable class of slaves or professionals. Some combat may involve mastery of esoteric weapons and complex arenas, while other forms might require nothing more than a declaration in the street and a drawn gun.
tags.ritualCombat.friends.2: Local eager to learn of offworld fighting styles
tags.ritualCombat.complications.0: The required weapons are strange pretech artifacts
tags.ritualCombat.complications.1: Certain classes are forbidden from fighting and require champions
tags.ritualCombat.complications.2: Loss doesn't mean death but it does mean ritual scarring or property loss
tags.ritualCombat.things.2: Token signifying immunity to ritual combat challenges
tags.robots.description: The world has a great many robots on it. Most bots are going to be non-sentient expert systems, though an AI with enough computing resources can control many bots at once, and some worlds may have developed VIs to a degree that individual bots can seem (or be) sentient. Some worlds might even be ruled by metal overlords, ones which do not need to be sentient so long as they have overwhelming force.
tags.robots.enemies.1: Robot greedy to seize offworld tech
tags.robots.enemies.2: Robot fallen in love with the pc's ship
tags.robots.friends.2: Local being pushed out of a job by robots
tags.robots.complications.0: The robots are only partially controlled
tags.robots.complications.1: The robots are salvaged and originally meant for a much darker use
tags.robots.complications.2: The robots require a rare material that the locals fight over
tags.robots.complications.3: The robots require the planet's specific infrastructure so cannot be exported
tags.robots.places.2: House crowded with robot servants and only one human owner
tags.seagoingCities.description: Either the world is entirely water or else the land is simply too dangerous for most humans. Human settlement on this world consists of a number of floating cities that follow the currents and the fish. These city-ships might have been purpose-built for their task, or they could be jury-rigged conglomerations of ships and structures thrown together when the need for seagoing life become apparent to the locals.
tags.seagoingCities.complications.1: The fish schools have vanished and the city faces starvation
tags.seagoingCities.complications.2: Terrible storms drive the city into the glacial regions
tags.seagoingCities.complications.3: Suicide ships ram the city's hull
tags.seagoingCities.things.0: Giant pearls with mysterious chemical properties
tags.seagoingCities.places.2: A bridge fashioned of many small boat
tags.sealedMenace.description: Something on this planet has the potential to create enormous havoc for the inhabitants if it is not kept safely contained by its keepers. Whether a massive seismic fault line suppressed by pretech terraforming technology, a disease that has to be quarantined within hours of discovery, or an ancient alien relic that requires regular upkeep in order to prevent planetary catastrophe, the menace is a constant shadow on the fearful populace.
tags.sealedMenace.enemies.0: Hostile outsider bent on freeing the menace
tags.sealedMenace.enemies.1: Misguided fool who thinks he can use it
tags.sealedMenace.enemies.2: Reckless researcher who thinks he can fix it
tags.sealedMenace.complications.0: The menace would bring great wealth along with destruction
tags.sealedMenace.complications.2: The natives don't all believe in the menace
tags.sealedMenace.things.0: A key to unlock the menace
tags.sealedMenace.things.1: A precious byproduct of the menace
tags.sealedMenace.things.2: The secret of the menace's true nature
tags.sealedMenace.places.2: Scene of a prior outbreak of the menace
tags.secretMasters.description: The world is actually run by a hidden cabal, acting through their catspaws in the visible government. For one reason or another, this group finds it imperative that they not be identified by outsiders, and in some cases even the planet's own government may not realize that they're actually being manipulated by hidden masters.
tags.secretMasters.enemies.1: Government official who wants no questions asked
tags.secretMasters.complications.0: The secret masters have a benign reason for wanting secrecy
tags.secretMasters.complications.1: The cabal fights openly amongst itself
tags.secretMasters.complications.2: The cabal is recruiting new members
tags.secretMasters.things.0: A dossier of secrets on a government official
tags.secretMasters.things.1: A briefcase of unmarked credit notes
tags.secretMasters.things.2: The identity of a cabal member
tags.sectarians.description: The world is torn by violent disagreement between sectarians of a particular faith. Each views the other as a damnable heresy in need of extirpation. Local government may be able to keep open war from breaking out, but the poisonous hatred divides communities. The nature of the faith may be religious, or it may be based on some secular ideology.
tags.sectarians.enemies.1: Native convinced the party is working for the other side
tags.sectarians.complications.0: The conflict has more than two sides
tags.sectarians.complications.1: The sectarians hate each other for multiple reasons
tags.sectarians.complications.2: The sectarians must cooperate or else life on this world is imperiled
tags.sectarians.complications.3: The sectarians hate outsiders more than they hate each other
tags.sectarians.complications.4: The differences in sects are incomprehensible to an outsider
tags.sectarians.things.2: Offering to a local holy man
tags.seismicInstability.description: The local land masses are remarkably unstable, and regular earthquakes rack the surface. Local construction is either advanced enough to sway and move with the vibrations or primitive enough that it is easily rebuilt. Severe volcanic activity may be part of the instability.
tags.seismicInstability.complications.0: The earthquakes are caused by malfunctioning pretech terraformers
tags.seismicInstability.complications.2: They're restrained by alien technology that is being plundered by offworlders
tags.seismicInstability.complications.3: The earthquakes are used to generate enormous amounts of energy
tags.seismicInstability.things.2: Mineral formed at the core of the world
tags.shackledWorld.description: This world is being systematically contained by an outside power. Some ancient autonomous defense grid, robot law enforcement, alien artifact, or other force is preventing the locals from developing certain technology, or using certain devices, or perhaps from developing interstellar flight. This limit may or may not apply to offworlders; in the former case, the PCs may have to figure out a way to beat the shackles simply to escape the world.
tags.shackledWorld.friends.2: Scientist with a plan to break the chains
tags.shackledWorld.complications.0: The shackles come off for certain brief windows of time
tags.shackledWorld.complications.1: The locals think the shackles are imposed by god
tags.shackledWorld.complications.2: An outside power greatly profits from the shackles
tags.shackledWorld.complications.3: The rulers are exempt from the shackles
tags.shackledWorld.things.2: Exportable version of the shackle that can affect other worlds
tags.shackledWorld.places.2: Temple to the power or entity that imposed the shackle
tags.societalDespair.description: The world's dominant society has lost faith in itself. Whether through some all-consuming war, great catastrophe, overwhelming outside culture, or religious collapse, the natives no longer believe in their old values, and search desperately for something new. Fierce conflict often exists between the last believers in the old dispensation and the nihilistic or searching disciples of the new age.
tags.societalDespair.enemies.0: Zealot who blames outsiders for the decay
tags.societalDespair.enemies.2: Offworlder looking to exploit the local despair
tags.societalDespair.friends.0: Struggling messenger of a new way
tags.societalDespair.friends.1: Valiant paragon of a fading tradition
tags.societalDespair.friends.2: Local going through the motions of serving a now-irrelevant role
tags.societalDespair.complications.0: A massive war discredited all the old values
tags.societalDespair.complications.1: Outside powers are working to erode societal confidence for their own benefit
tags.societalDespair.complications.2: A local power is profiting greatly from the despair
tags.societalDespair.complications.3: The old ways were meant to aid survival on this world and their passing is causing many new woes
tags.societalDespair.things.0: Relic that would inspire a renaissance
tags.societalDespair.things.1: Art that would inspire new ideas
tags.societalDespair.things.2: Priceless artifact of a now-scorned belief
tags.societalDespair.places.2: Smoky hall full of frantic speakers
tags.soleSupplier.description: Some extremely important resource is exported from this world and this world alone. It's unlikely that the substance is critical for building spike drives unless this world is also the first to begin interstellar flight, but it may be critical to other high-tech processes or devices. The locals make a large amount of money off this trade and control of it is of critical importance to the planet's rulers, and potentially to outside powers.
tags.soleSupplier.enemies.3: Foreign agent seeking to subvert local government
tags.soleSupplier.friends.1: Researcher trying to synthesize the stuff
tags.soleSupplier.complications.0: The substance is slow poison to process
tags.soleSupplier.complications.1: The substance is created by hostile alien natives
tags.soleSupplier.complications.2: The substance is very easy to smuggle in usable amounts
tags.soleSupplier.complications.3: Only the natives have the genes or tech to extract it effectively
tags.soleSupplier.things.1: Trade permit to buy a load of it
tags.soleSupplier.things.2: A shipment of nigh-undetectably fake substance
tags.soleSupplier.places.1: Opulent palace built with resource money
